definition: The duration for which the lease agreement is valid.
A refundable amount held to cover potential damage or unpaid rent.
An arrangement where the original tenant rents out the property to another party.
The legal process by which a landlord removes a tenant from rental property.
Clause defining which party is responsible for upkeep and repairs.
A clause that restricts an employee from working with competitors for a period after leaving a company.
An employment relationship where either party can terminate at any time without cause.
A trial period at the start of employment during which either party may terminate the contract.
Compensation offered to an employee upon involuntary termination.
Creations of the mind such as inventions, literary works, designs, which are legally protected.
A clause that frees both parties from liability when extraordinary events prevent fulfillment.
Specifies the conditions under which a contract can be ended.
Obligation of one party to compensate another for losses or damages.
A method of resolving disputes outside of court, where an arbitrator makes the decision.
A contract in which one party agrees not to disclose information.
Promises made by one party regarding the condition or functionality of goods/services.
A clause that limits the amount or type of damages one party can recover.
Specifies which jurisdictionâ€™s laws apply to the contract.
States that the written contract represents the complete agreement between parties.
A person contracted to perform work but not as an employee.
Defines performance metrics and responsibilities for service delivery.
A section that describes specific tasks, deliverables, and timelines.
Details about when and how payments will be made.
A violation of any of the agreed-upon terms in a binding contract.
Allows one party to end the contract due to a specific breach or event.
Transfer of rights or obligations from one party to another.
Voluntary relinquishment of a known right or claim.
Details how official communication between parties should be made.
A change or addition to the original contract terms.
Legal terms users must agree to in order to use a service.
Any data, text, or media submitted by users to a platform or service.
Guidelines for proper use of a service or platform.
A statement explaining how user data is collected, used, and protected.
Permission granted to a user to do something that would otherwise be forbidden.
External services or content provided by entities other than the primary service provider.
Clause allowing changes to the agreement, often with user notification.
Specifies which courts have authority in case of legal disputes.
A statement that denies responsibility for certain outcomes or actions.
Restricts the amount of liability a party may have under certain conditions.
The length of time that data or documents must be stored.
Details when a contract starts, ends, and under what conditions it may terminate.
Defines how disputes will be handled, such as via arbitration or mediation.
The date on which the contract becomes enforceable.
Statements of fact and promises made by the parties.
Specifies which obligations continue after contract termination.
A legal contract preventing disclosure of sensitive information.
A contract outlining the terms of employment between employer and employee.
A situation where a party's judgment may be influenced by personal interest.
Review of a person's criminal, financial, or employment history.
The party offering services under the agreement.
Responsibilities that the client agrees to under the contract.
Measures and policies to safeguard personal data.
Adherence to laws, regulations, and standards applicable to the contract.
Legal rights that grant creators control over their inventions and works.
Prevents one party from soliciting the other party's employees or clients.
A timeline outlining when payments are due under the contract.
